# Task

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.



# Special Instructions

None.

Sure, here is the solution in Julia using DataFrames package:

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> year(x)*100 + month(x), df.dt)
end
```
This function takes a DataFrame as input and adds a new column `ym` to it. The values in this new column are the years (extracted from the DateTimes with `year` function) multiplied by 100 and added to the months extracted from the same DateTimes with `month` function.

Here is how you can use it:
```julia
using DataFrames, Dates
df = DataFrame(dt=[Date(2021,1,1), Date(2022,2,28)], other_column=["a", "b"])
add_yearmonth(df)
```
This will add a new column `ym` to the DataFrame `df` with values 202101 and 202202 for the dates January 2021 and February 2022, respectively.
